intro: Nigritella graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered nigritella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Nigritella graciliflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
